text: The MIT Lincoln Laboratory, located in Lexington, Massachusetts, is a United States Department of Defense federally funded research and development center. It is used to help advanced technology to problems of national security. The Laboratory gives a technical base for military electronics ranging from radars to reentry physics.Statement of Lt. Gen. James Ferguson, Deputy Chief of Staff of Staff, Research and Development, USAF, Hearings on military posture and H.R. 13456, p. 8454. ==References== Category:United States Department of Defense
title: MIT Lincoln Laboratory
